name: UBX-NAV2-STATUS
description: Receiver navigation status. See important comments concerning the validity of the position given in section Navigation output filters in the Integration manual.

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. For details, see section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual.

fields.name: gpsFix
fields.description: GPSfix Type, this value does not qualify a fix as valid and within the limits. See note on flag gpsFixOk below. 0x00 = no fix, 0x01 = dead reckoning only, 0x02 = 2D-fix, 0x03 = 3D-fix, 0x04 = GPS + dead reckoning combined, 0x05 = Time only fix, 0x06..0xff = reserved.

fields.name: flags
fields.description:
Navigation Status Flags.
Bit 0 (gpsFixOk): 1 = position and velocity valid and within DOP and ACC Masks.
Bit 1 (diffSoln): 1 = differential corrections were applied.
Bit 2 (wknSet): 1 = Week Number valid (for details, see section Time validity in the Integration manual).
Bit 3 (towSet): 1 = Time of Week valid (for details, see section Time validity in the integration manual).

fields.name: fixStat
fields.description:
Fix Status Information.
Bit 0 (diffCorr): 1 = differential corrections available.
Bit 1 (carrSolnValid): 1 = valid carrSoln.
Bits 7...6 (mapMatching): map matching status: 00 = none.

fields.name: flags2
fields.description:
Further information about navigation output.
Bits 1...0 (psmState): power save mode state (not supported for protocol versions less than 13.01): 0 = ACQUISITION [or when psm disabled], 1 = TRACKING, 2 = POWER OPTIMIZED TRACKING, 3 = INACTIVE.
Bits 4...3 (spoofDetState): Spoofing detection state (not supported for protocol versions less than 18.00): 0: Unknown or deactivated, 1: No spoofing indicated, 2: Spoofing indicated, 3: Multiple spoofing indications. Note that the spoofing state value only reflects the detector state for the current navigation epoch. As spoofing can be detected most easily at the transition from real signal to spoofing signal, this is also where...
